articles.author: Elizabeth Pineau, Dominique Vidalon
articles.description: Prime Minister Michel Barnier dropped planned cuts to medication reimbursements in a last-minute bid to get his 2025 budget bill over the line.
articles.title: France's Barnier makes last-minute concession to far right in bid to avoid being toppled

articles.author: Suleiman Al-Khalidi, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Hundreds of fighters from Iran-backed Iraqi militias crossed into Syria overnight to help the government fight rebels who seized Aleppo last week, Syrian and Iraqi sources said on Monday, and Tehran pledged to aid the Damascus government.
articles.title: Iraqi militias enter Syria to reinforce government forces, military sources say

articles.author: Patricia Zengerle
articles.description: The United States will provide Ukraine with a $725 million weapons package, Secretary of State Antony Blinken said on Monday, as President Joe Biden's outgoing administration seeks to bolster the government in Kyiv in its war with Russian invaders before leaving office in January.
articles.title: US announces Ukraine weapons package worth $725 million

articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Adam Makary
articles.description: The Israeli military said on Monday it struck dozens of targets throughout Lebanon, shortly after Hezbollah accused Israel of violating a ceasefire agreement and fired missiles on an Israeli military position in the disputed Shebaa Farms area.
articles.title: Israel strikes Lebanon after Hezbollah attack as ceasefire violations mount

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The number of migrants reaching Spain's Canary Islands on precarious vessels from West Africa has hit an all-time annual record with 41,425 arrivals between Jan. 1 and Nov. 30 of this year, Interior Ministry data showed on Monday.
articles.title: Number of migrants reaching Spain's Canary Islands breaks all-time record

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Harvey Weinstein was taken to hospital on Monday for treatment after an "alarming" blood test result that required immediate medical attention, and he is expected to stay there until his condition stabilizes, his lawyer said.
articles.title: Harvey Weinstein taken to hospital after 'alarming' blood test, his lawyer says

articles.author: Pavel Polityuk, Tom Balmforth
articles.description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz announced new military aid for Ukraine during a rare visit on Monday that he said sent a message to Russian President Vladimir Putin that Berlin would stand by Kyiv for as long as needed in the war.
articles.title: Germany's Scholz pledges new military aid to Ukraine during rare Kyiv trip

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Police in Georgia fired water cannon and tear gas to disperse protesters in Tbilisi, the capital, who opposed the government's decision to suspend talks on joining the European Union, while some were detained, Russian agencies said on Monday.
articles.title: Georgia police fire tear gas to scatter protesters, Russian agencies say

articles.author: Luis Jaime Acosta
articles.description: Colombia's illegal armed groups have taken advantage of the government's pursuit of peace to strengthen themselves militarily and economically, the commander of the country's armed forces said on Monday.
articles.title: Colombia armed groups used peace talks to build strength, military commander says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Slovakia expelled two men suspected of monitoring energy infrastructure targets including along a major pipeline carrying gas from Ukraine, and Interior Minister Matus Sutaj Estok said on Monday security services had dismantled a rogue cell.
articles.title: Slovakia expels two for suspected monitoring of energy targets, including gas pipeline
